comments.body: Is this where we want to put this file?  I wonder if we should have it be in `examples/stocks/test/driver/scroll_perf.dart`.  We've been trying to have Flutter apps follow the Dart conventions for packages.

Eventually we'll move all driver tests under `test`, but today we are unable to tell them apart from unit-tests. For example, `flutter test` and `pub run test` will attempt to run a driver test, and will fail. Once we gain ability to use `@TestOn` we should be able to put all tests under `test` and run `pub run test -p flutter_driver` and have `flutter test` recognize them out-of-the-box.

Currently we key off the `_test.dart` suffix, so putting this `_perf.dart` file in `test` should be fine.  We should have TestOn support pretty soon.  The test package just published a release that will let us integrate in a less hacky way.

Anyway, I didn't mean to bikeshed your patch.  We can always move the file around.  :)

Yeah, there are other places where I already use `test_driver`. Also, not all the tests are performance tests. Some are simply integration tests. We could use a more generic prefix, perhaps `_e2e.dart`. The issue though, is that `pub run test` has no way to specify a custom prefix. I'll start an email thread to discuss. Should be fixable. We just need to pick something.
This issue doesn't need to block this patch.  LGTM
